Class PDHello

java.lang.Object
  com.cycling74.max.MaxObject
      PDHello
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.cycling74.max.Executable
public class PDHello
extends com.cycling74.max.MaxObject
implements com.cycling74.max.Executable

A "Hello World"-esque MaxObject based on pdj_test_class. Pumps a float out of the outlet every clock tick, similar to the PD "metro" object. Two Inlets are defined. The hot inlet on the left side reacts to a "bang" (the "do it" imperative in PD). The cold inlet on the right hand side accepts a value representing the BPM at which the metronome should tick. Read here to understand the difference between hot and cold inlets.

Author:
Ciarán Rowe (csr2@kent.ac.uk)

Constructor Detail

PDHello

public PDHello()
Constructs a MaxObject for PD that accepts a float on the cold inlet (BPM), and a bang on the hot inlet (on/off). Sends a float on the outlet using the clock to tick at the specified BPM.

PDHello

public PDHello(com.cycling74.max.Atom[] args)
Constructor used when arguments are passed to the object. This doesn't do anything special except handle for the case where arguments are passed to the constructor. You can pass the arguments by making the object with "pdj PDHello arg1 arg2 [...]" etc.

Parameters:
args - An array of Atom objects.
Method Detail

execute

public void execute()
Implements the method executed by MaxClock every clock tick. Each tick plays out a note if the metronome is active, and sets a new delay on the clock - this is effectively a recursive method (it calls itself) while we're in an active state.

Specified by:
execute in interface com.cycling74.max.Executable

bang

protected void bang()
Called when the object receives a bang from PD. Bang means "do it" in PD. Bang objects in PD are effectively a metaphor for non-latching switches in circuits. Will activate/deactivate the metronome.

Overrides:
bang in class com.cycling74.max.MaxObject

inlet

protected void inlet(float f)
Called when the cold inlet is activated. As a rule, cold inlets don't produce anything from the outlet, but they do change the internal state or stored values within an object.

Overrides:
inlet in class com.cycling74.max.MaxObject
Parameters:
f - A number representing the BPM.
